mainEntity.name: How often should I have my chimney cleaned?

acceptedAnswer.text: At least once a year or every 50 fires—whichever comes first. If you burn daily in winter or notice soot or odors, schedule sooner.

mainEntity.name: What signs mean I need a chimney inspection or cleaning?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smoky odors, black residue (creosote), poor fireplace draft, visible cracks, or debris in the firebox are common signs. An annual level-2 inspection is recommended after any changes or a chimney fire.

mainEntity.name: How long does a standard chimney sweep take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most cleanings take 60–90 minutes. If repairs or a level-2 inspection are needed, allow extra time.

mainEntity.name: Can you help with smoke smell or poor draft?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. We check for creosote buildup, cap or damper issues, pressure problems, and chimney height. We recommend the fix based on what we find.
